t: Psalm 31
To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David.
In*p thee, O Lord,*s do I put my trust; let me never be ashamed: deliver me in thy righteousness.
Bow*p down thine ear to me; deliver me speedily: be thou my strong rock, for an house of defence to save me.
For*p thou art my rock and my fortress; therefore for thy name's sake lead me, and guide me.
Pull*p me out of the net that they have laid privily for me: for thou art my strength.
Into*p thine hand I commit my spirit: thou hast redeemed me, O Lord*s God of truth.
I*p have hated them that regard lying vanities: but I trust in the Lord.*s
I*p will be glad and rejoice in thy mercy: for thou hast considered my trouble; thou hast known my soul in adversities;
And*p hast not shut me up into the hand of the enemy: thou hast set my feet in a large room.
Have*p mercy upon me, O Lord,*s for I am in trouble: mine eye is consumed with grief, yea, my soul and my belly.
For*p my life is spent with grief, and my years with sighing: my strength faileth because of mine iniquity, and my bones are consumed.
I*p was a reproach among all mine enemies, but especially among my neighbours, and a fear to mine acquaintance: they that did see me without fled from me.
I*p am forgotten as a dead man out of mind: I am like a broken vessel.
For*p I have heard the slander of many: fear was on every side: while they took counsel together against me, they devised to take away my life.
But*p I trusted in thee, O Lord:*s I said, Thou art my God.
My*p times are in thy hand: deliver me from the hand of mine enemies, and from them that persecute me.
Make*p thy face to shine upon thy servant: save me for thy mercies' sake.
Let*p me not be ashamed, O Lord;*s for I have called upon thee: let the wicked be ashamed, and let them be silent in the grave.
Let*p the lying lips be put to silence; which speak grievous things proudly and contemptuously against the righteous.
Oh*p how great is thy goodness, which thou hast laid up for them that fear thee; which thou hast wrought for them that trust in thee before the sons of men!
Thou*p shalt hide them in the secret of thy presence from the pride of man: thou shalt keep them secretly in a pavilion from the strife of tongues.
Blessed*p be the Lord:*s for he hath shewed me his marvellous kindness in a strong city.
For*p I said in my haste, I am cut off from before thine eyes: nevertheless thou heardest the voice of my supplications when I cried unto thee.
O*p love the Lord,*s all ye his saints: for the Lord*s preserveth the faithful, and plentifully rewardeth the proud doer.
Be*p of good courage, and he shall strengthen your heart, all ye that hope in the Lord.*s
